article.headline: UT-Chattanooga 93, East Tenn. St. 59
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. (AP) -- Alphonso Pugh scored 23 points and two Chattanooga teammates had double-doubles in the Mocs 93-59 victory over East Tennessee State on Saturday. Chris Brown scored 15 points and grabbed 12 rebounds, while Mindaugas Katelynas added 14 points and 10 rebounds for the Mocs (12-4, 5-1), who snapped a four-game losing streak to ETSU (6-11, 2-5). The Mocs opened the game with a 9-0 run, and led 45-30 at halftime. Tim Smith, who finished with 16 points, hit a 3-pointer for the Bucs with 18:37 left to make it 47-33. But Chattanooga answered with a 14-4 run capped by a jumper by Pugh. The Mocs extend their lead to as many as 35 in the second half as they outrebounded the Bucs 50-22. The two squads have met in the Southern Conference tournament finals each of the last two years, but ETSU has had a disappointing season after back-to-back NCAA Tournament appearances. Casey Long scored 14 points for Chattanooga, while Ben Rhoda and Travis Strong had 12 points each for ETSU.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
